metaDescription.en-US: Having created the brand identity, packaging and brand assets, we were asked to design their e-commerce site and collaborate on the online strategy to be launched in the UK.

intro.en-US: User research and interface design for Babingtons Blends' e-commerce site and which was the main part of the Italian Tea rooms' launch in the UK market.

content.value: I collaborated with our Marketing Director and Social media planner on the online strategy and produced content and campaign material for all of Babingtons' social media platforms and other printed advertising mediums.

description1.en-US: Our goal was to recreate a modern and younger version of the Italian tea platform for a target of young tea drinkers in an already very competive tea market.

description2.en-US:
With the supervision of my creative director I thought out the customer journey by laying out the website architecture, designing the main pages + drawing up the checkout, customer login.

In addition, I worked alongside a Developer, SEO researcher, the Marketing Manager and Social Media Planner.

content.value: We knew the brand well, and we agreed something had to change for the UK market and this is where the product rationalisation came in. The stucture of the website had to be simple, but also the formats of products needed to be immediately recognisable. We explored various bold and colourful styles for both site and products.

Babingtons Tea Rooms in Rome, a long term client of Minale Tattersfield, came to us for the UK launch of their range of products. We created their ecommerce site and all their marketing and social media campaigns as well as creating all the bespoke external packaging necessary for the delivery of products.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield; Cliency

skills.en-US: Creative Content / UX Research / UI Design / Campaign Strategy

content.value: Design of an organic wine company's online platform and content creation for social media use - the importance of being in contact with nature was highlighted in their wine ranges as well as their website.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield

skills.en-US: Creative Content / Branded assets / Animation / Illustration / Pattern design

content.value: We created a responsive website design for Bervini‚Äôs online shop and I was also responsible for creating the content needed for their online launch.

carouselDescription.en-US: The Illustration was applied to all four of the bottles of the Natura Prosecco range. Each label illustration has a different tint and gold foil details and the Bervini symbol is printed in braille.

metaDescription.en-US: Brand Development and packaging design for an Italian organic wine producer Bervini.

intro.en-US: Design of an organic wine company's online platform and content creation for social media use - the importance of being in contact with nature was highlighted in their wine ranges as well as their website.

title.en-US: Verona Airport Marketing Campaign for Cortina Winter Olympics 2026

intro.en-US: While I was working at Minale Tattersfield, we were commissioned to create Trentino's Winter Olympics 2026 marketing campaign for Verona airport's arrival area.

subtitle.en-US: Interior branding of arrival area at Catullo airport for Trentino Marketing

content.value: For the Catullo Airport project aimed at welcoming travellers for the 2026 Winter Olympics, the interior branding effort to recreate the Trentino landscape serves to immerse visitors in the region's beauty upon arrival. Minale Tattersfield was commissioned to design a winter and a summer theme for the whole of Verona airport's arrival area.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield / Marco Yip

skills.en-US: Interior branding / Photo editing / Exterior signage / Artwork

content.value: This project aimed to blend Italian craftsmanship with sustainability, focusing on redesigning packaging for Bonaveri. We reviewed processes, materials, and costs, incorporating prototyping, environmental analysis, and user experience improvements. Collaborative efforts ensured the eco-friendly, practical packaging aligned with Bonaveri's standards, highlighting a comprehensive, stakeholder-engaged approach to innovation and design.

team.en-US: Selene Bonato - Claudia Gelmini - Bianca Draghetti

skills.en-US: Prototyping and Testing / Environmental Impact Analysis / User Experience Design / Stakeholder Engagement

content.value: The solution was a modular and collapsible design that minimized environmental impact without compromising on elegance. This innovative packaging was easier to transport and store, reducing the carbon footprint associated with the distribution of Bonaveri's products and enhancing the unboxing experience for clients.

metaDescription.en-US: Reducing quantity and swapping materials for eco-friendly solutions helped us maintain the high standard of protection the mannequins need to arrive intact at their destination.

intro.en-US: Reducing the quantity of materials and swapping them for eco-friendly solutions helped maintain the high standard of protection the mannequins need to arrive intact at their destination.

content.value: Creation of jewellery item for historic museum in Bologna, Palazzo Poggi.

team.en-US: Silvia Carbone - Irene Conversano

content.value: While working at Minale Tattersfield, a significant project undertaken was the development of the brand identity and interior design translation for Salty Commune.

This initiative aimed to establish a distinct and resonant brand identity for Salty Commune and seamlessly integrate this identity with the space's interior design, reflecting the vibrant community it serves.

metaDescription.en-US: Salty Commune is a co-working space in Hoxton which opened in the summer of 2019. Minale Tattersfield created their brand identity and translated it to fit their interiors.

intro.en-US: Developing the brand identity and extending it to the interior design for Salty Commune, a forward-thinking co-working space located in Hoxton, launched in the summer of 2019.

subtitle.en-US: Label Design for Luisa's Wine Range

content.value: We took on the task of refreshing Luisa's wine labels, aiming to blend its authentic roots with a modern, classy look that reflects its journey in the wine world.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield

skills.en-US: Illustration / Pattern design / Branding / Packaging

description1.en-US: This family-run wine business is a loyal client of Minale Tattersfield and came back for a review of their current labels in 2019.

description2.en-US:
We needed to shift from a young and offbeat look and think about Luisa being more established and rooted in the local and international wine market.

I worked on the pattern study and created a different motif for each wine and created and finalised the artwork for the range.

metaDescription.en-US: Shifting from a young and offbeat look to a more elegant and refined image of Luisa - A matured wine company being which has become more established and rooted in the local and international wine market, having worked on their brand awareness.

intro.en-US: Illustration and label artwork for Tenuta Luisa a wine producer in northern Italy looking to refine the look of its range of wines.

content.value: Patterns created by merging the Victorian illustrations used throughout Babingtons' packaging and branded assets. Inspired by the Tea Room's quirkiness, these patterns blend tradition with fun, adding to Babingtons' unique style.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director

skills.en-US: Illustration / Pattern Design / Artworking

description1.en-US: Creating patterns by merging the Victorian illustrations used throughout Babingtons' packaging.

description2.en-US: Having sketched a few directions, I created four patterns to apply on the various pieces of the set. I interacted with the suppliers and did the final handover by preparing all the technical drawings and mockups.

content.value: The book serves as a bridge connecting the past to the present, inviting readers to explore and recreate recipes that have been a part of Babingtons' legacy since the opening of its Tea Rooms at the foot of the Spanish Steps.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield

skills.en-US: Book Layout / Indesign / Illustration / Cover Design

content.value: A card game designed to help children over ten learn about Renaissance art. It's designed for museum visits, turning art viewing into an interactive game. This way, children can play their way through understanding complex artworks, making each museum trip an exciting adventure in learning.

content.value: Good design is sustainable design - Imran Amed
I see design not as a solution but as a dynamic tool for inquiry and transformation. I work in
Brand Strategy, Packaging, Interior Visualisation and Online Launches and love the intersection of design and art, and the different approaches I find in the places I travel to.

A series of label designs were created for Hubble, a brand that focuses on supplements specifically designed for men, aimed at securing a prominent position in the health supplement marketplace. The objective was to develop labels that not only catch the eye but also provide clear, informative content suited to people looking for nutritional support.

metaDescription.en-US: Book cover and layout design for Victorian Tea Rooms in Rome

intro.en-US: Anniversary book design for Babingtons Tea Rooms in Rome, highlighting quirky history through creative layout and colour selection.

content.value: For the significant milestone of Babingtons Tea Rooms' 125th anniversary, Minale Tattersfield was entrusted with the creation of a commemorative book that captures the enchanting atmosphere and rich history of this iconic establishment. Founded by two Victorian ladies, Babingtons Tea Rooms offers a uniquely quirky experience, a theme that was to be vividly brought to life in this anniversary book.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield

needed for their online launch.

intro.en-US: Digital design created for an organic winery in the north of Italy. After the work on the labels and packaging, the aim was to launch Bervini's new look on all their platforms.

content.value: Fun and witty artwork created for printed and digital campaigns across Babingtons Blends' online platforms, OOH and printed mediums.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale - Creative Director @ Minale Tattersfield

skills.en-US: Content Ideation / Artwork / Illustration / Animation / Poster Design / Mockup Creation

metaDescription.en-US: Graphics, animations and campaign material for Babingtons Blends

intro.en-US: Fun and witty artwork created for printed and digital campaigns across Babingtons Blends' online platforms, OOH and printed mediums.

content.value: We created a responsive website design for Bervini‚Äôs online shop and I was also responsible for creating the content needed for their online launch.

Working closely with Marcello Minale on various projects for Babingtons Blends, the famous Victorian Tea Rooms in Rome, was exciting. Being Anglo-Italian, I felt complete synergy when creating graphics, illustrations, and animations for their marketing campaigns to launch their new platform in the UK. This project marked a slightly different journey from previous ones, targeting a new market outside Italy.

Our aim was to create material that was quirky and colourful, young and witty, rejuvenating the historical brand's image for the UK market. Over two years, I contributed to website UX/UI design, printed adverts for magazines, OOH, B2B/B2C stationery, and online content.

Moving away from the British-Italian essence that characterised our previous designs for Rome, we introduced wit for consumer interaction with the product and brand. We played with the word 'Tea', integrating it with Victorian illustrations across the branding assets and using a bold, condensed typeface for loud and indiscreet presence on all platforms. Naming products and bundles playfully, we maintained Babingtons' essence while adapting the new brand, Babingtons Blends, for better positioning in the UK market.

Constrained by small budgets for photo-shoots, we relied heavily on graphics, typography, and illustrations to build the online brand image. Launching a new brand in the UK's competitive market demanded a distinct approach, leading to the creation of "We don't just sell tea".

Working closely with the directors, especially the Marketing Director and the Social Media Manager, offered a comprehensive insight into brand launching, from the e-commerce platform to the final social media content and timeline.

description1.en-US: The goal was to create a website that reflected Bervini's values, bringing the simplicity of Italian vineyards to online consumers. The design used visuals, illustrations, and narratives inspired by their vineyards, encouraging users to explore a less impactful way of drinking. "Bere bene" meaning "Drink well" guided our approach.

description2.en-US: I was in charge of UX research, UI design, and prototyping in Adobe XD, along with creating online content and graphics.

description1.en-US: We needed to maintain packaging costs below current low levels, especially considering the mannequins' most fragile parts‚Äîthe arms and hands‚Äîwhich are pre-attached. Another challenge was improving the ergonomics for workers filling the packaging, previously an uncomfortable task due to the use of polystyrene chips. This required a complete redesign of the packaging to enhance sustainability, practicality, and adherence to Bonaveri's luxury image.

description2.en-US: By creating a bespoke box specifically for the arms, and rethinking the box's internal layout, we streamlined the process, reducing costs and waste. This new eco-friendly packaging is easier to handle and aligns with Bonaveri's values, offering an organized presentation and improved aesthetics.

content.value: The new sustainable and eco-friendly packaging we designed at Bonaveri was adopted by the company and received recognition. It was awarded a prize by Conai for its outstanding concept, excelling both technically and in design.

We needed to maintain packaging costs below current low levels, especially considering the mannequins' most fragile parts‚Äîthe arms and hands‚Äîwhich are pre-attached. Another challenge was improving the ergonomics for workers filling the packaging, previously an uncomfortable task due to the use of polystyrene chips. This required a complete redesign of the packaging to enhance sustainability, practicality, and adherence to Bonaveri's luxury image.

By creating a bespoke box specifically for the arms, and rethinking the box's internal layout, we streamlined the process, reducing costs and waste. This new eco-friendly packaging is easier to handle and aligns with Bonaveri's values, offering an organized presentation and improved aesthetics.

The challenge was to evolve from a youthful image to embody Luisa's more mature market position. My task involved designing unique patterns for each wine, crafting motifs that narrated Luisa's story, and completing the artwork to showcase the brand's sophisticated legacy.

description1.en-US: As a mature, family-run business and a returning client of Minale Tattersfield, Luisa sought a label refresh in 2019 to mirror its established reputation in both local and international markets.

description2.en-US: The challenge was to evolve from a youthful image to embody Luisa's more mature market position. My task involved designing unique patterns for each wine, crafting motifs that narrated Luisa's story, and completing the artwork to showcase the brand's sophisticated legacy.

content.value: Photographic material for a study on ventilation shafts in London - Our Hut, an architectural education charity, was in collaboration with Layers of London a platform used to filter subjects of interest in Greater London.
The photos were also inserted in an
article
by
Oliver Wainwright
for The Guardian.
I enjoy the variety of the projects I work on. I have worked with clients from UK and Italy on projects such as
packaging ranges for Victorian Tea Rooms
, the
interiors of a Distillery
, the graphic rebranding of an International Airport, the launch of an organic wine e-commerce, campaign strategy and content for
UK F&B brand launch
, 3D design for VinItaly stands, Book Design for 50th Anniversary of famous Soho restaurant.

intro.en-US: Branding and cross-media content creation for Humanitarian Designer's Meetup Lab at CERN IdeaSquare, in Geneva. The event brought together forty participants from different backgrounds in design and humanitarian aid.

skills.en-US: Branding / UI / Artworking

team.en-US: Catarina Batista, Gwenn Descamps, Yara Dobra, Christoph Erle, C√©dric Fettouche, Thomas J√§ger, Olivier Lauras, Pierre Rabant, Cecilia Scolaro

skills.en-US: Branding / Print and Digital Artwork / Communication

intro.en-US: A rebranding for an osteria in Tuscany. The humble staff and the elegance of the food was woven into the Osteria's brand identity which was refined to create a harmonious balance between the history of the restaurant and its modern cuisine.

Website design for a travel blog. Design of a travel blog focused on showcasing personal tales and cultural facts from around the world. An intuitive layout was created to highlight the photographic and written content.

content.value: Rinaldi is a wine and spirits supplier founded in Bologna in 1957. This project consisted of the design and production of their product catalogues with over 250 wines and 600 spirits. I was responsible for the production side, i.e. from setting up design systems for the typography, colours and graphics to final checks on production files and specifications.

team.en-US: Marcello Minale, Edoardo Bacchin

skills.en-US: Production, Photo editing, Colour calibration

intro.en-US: Rinaldi is a wine and spirits supplier founded in Bologna in 1957. This project consisted of the design and production of their product catalogues.
